slides.title: Fray Bartolomé de Olmedo Christening Indians
slides.caption: Baptism became a symbol marking assimilation and conversion to European customs among the Native Americans.
slides.source: Courtesy of Madrid, Museum of America

slides.title: Apostle of the Indies
slides.caption: Engravings such as this one illustrated early editions of Bartolomé de las Casas' writings that denounced Spanish colonizers' cruelty toward Native Americans. Las Casas became known to many as the "Apostle of the Indies" for standing up against the abuses of colonization. His writings also provided fodder for the Black Legend.
slides.source: Courtesy of Dorothy Sloan Rare Books

slides.title: The Snake Dance of the Moqui Indians
slides.caption: This 1889 engraving illustrates the Snake Dance of the Moqui Indians. It appeared in the November 2 issue of "Harper's Weekly" that year.
slides.source: Courtesy of New Mexico Museum of Art
